meanings.definition: Divide into large pieces or chunks.
meanings.sent1: She chunked the vegetables for the stew.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter chunked the wood for the project.
meanings.sent3: He chunked the cake into big pieces for everyone to enjoy.
meanings.sent4: The team chunked the tasks to finish the project faster.
meanings.sent5: The sculptor chunked the clay to create a masterpiece.

meanings.definition: To break down into manageable parts.
meanings.sent1: The teacher chunked the lesson for easier understanding.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic chunked the engine repair into steps.
meanings.sent3: She chunked the laundry to make the chore less overwhelming.
meanings.sent4: The chef chunked the recipe to simplify the cooking process.
meanings.sent5: He chunked the project to tackle it bit by bit.

meanings.definition: To group or organize into sections.
meanings.sent1: The librarian chunked the books by genre.
meanings.sent2: The manager chunked the tasks for the team members.
meanings.sent3: She chunked the closet to make finding clothes easier.
meanings.sent4: The student chunked the notes for better studying.
meanings.sent5: He chunked the files to keep them organized.
